metadata.subject: Collection of news articles on international affairs

organizations: Washington Institute for Near East Policy
Center for Strategic and International Studies
Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula

relationships.description: Donilon serves as national security adviser to President Obama
Perle is a resident fellow at AEI
AKP is the ruling party in Turkey implementing conservative policies
Al Qaeda seeking to exploit post-revolution chaos in Arab world
Debate over continued US military presence in Iraq
Contrasting approaches to international intervention in Libya

analysis.purpose: To provide analysis of current international affairs and policy debates
analysis.significance: Collection of expert opinions on critical global security issues from 2011 period

notable_quotes: "The hypocrisy of claiming to support reform in other countries while suppressing it at home is obvious for all the world to see." - Tom Donilon on Iran
"The goal of a world free of nuclear weapons, the dream that has come to be called 'global zero.'" - Richard Perle

"Al Qaeda's leaders also know that this is a strategic moment. They are banking on the disillusionment that inevitably follows revolutions to reassert their prominence in the region." - Juan C. Zarate

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion in these policy analysis articles

illegal_activity.description: Document contains news articles and policy analysis - no first-hand illegal activity discussed

details: Collection of articles from major publications: Financial Times, World Affairs, The Daily Star, NYT, Wall Street Journal
Articles written by policy experts and journalists analyzing current events

public_knowledge.context: These are published news articles from 2011 covering international affairs that were already public information

analysis.summary: This document is a compilation of six news articles from April 2011 covering international affairs topics including nuclear non-proliferation debates, Turkish political trends, Al Qaeda's response to Arab Spring uprisings, US military strategy in Iraq, and contrasting French-German approaches to international intervention. The articles represent policy analysis from experts in their respective fields.
